articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: New York's highest court on Thursday overturned the 2020 sex crimes conviction of former Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein, in the case that helped trigger the #MeToo movement.
articles.title: Harvey Weinstein's conviction overturned by top New York court

articles.author: John Kruzel, Andrew Chung
articles.description: Conservative U.S. Supreme Court justices signaled sympathy on Thursday to the argument that presidents have some immunity against criminal charges for certain actions taken in office as it heard arguments over Donald Trump's claim of immunity from prosecution for trying to undo his 2020 election loss.
articles.title: US Supreme Court justices in Trump case lean toward some level of immunity

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial is set to resume in New York on Thursday with a former tabloid publisher testifying about efforts to help Trump's 2016 presidential bid by burying negative stories, including an alleged affair with a former Playboy model.
articles.title: Hush money testimony expected to focus on payment to ex-Playboy model

articles.author: Jonathan Allen, Brendan O'Brien
articles.description: A stalemate at Columbia University over removing a student encampment to protest Israel's war in Gaza has spawned a wave of similar demonstrations on college campuses across the U.S., but authorities have shut down many before they can take root.
articles.title: Columbia University inspires national protest wave, swift response by authorities

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel stepped up airstrikes on Rafah overnight, killing at least six Palestinians, medics said on Thursday, after saying it would evacuate civilians from the Gaza border city and storm it despite allies' warnings this could cause mass casualties.
articles.title: Israel intensifies strikes on Gaza's Rafah ahead of threatened invasion

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The United States hopes its new deliveries of weaponry will help Ukraine rebuild defenses and refit its forces as it recovers from a gap in U.S. assistance, but it does not expect Kyiv to launch large-scale offensive operations against Russian forces in the near term, a U.S. defense official said on Thursday.
articles.title: US and allies aim to help Ukraine bolster defenses after aid gap

articles.author: Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Several thousand Indigenous demonstrators marched chanting to drum beats on Thursday to the seat of power in Brazil's capital to protest against the government's failure to protect their ancestral lands.
articles.title: Indigenous people protest Brazil not protecting ancestral lands

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Thursday the outright seizure of Russian assets is justifiable but is only one possibility, with assets instead able to serve as collateral for borrowing in the market to help Ukraine.
articles.title: Yellen says range of options to deal with frozen Russian assets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Colombian attorney general's office has suspended arrest warrants for nine leaders of the illegal armed group Segunda Marquetalia, it said on Thursday, as part of a process to start peace talks between the group and the government.
articles.title: Colombia arrest warrants suspended for nine Segunda Marquetalia leaders

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A pro-Palestinian U.S. group filed a federal civil rights complaint against Columbia University following last week's mass arrest of anti-war protesters after the school called police to clear demonstrator encampments, the group said on Thursday.
articles.title: Columbia University faces federal complaint after arresting anti-war protesters
